sentences.sContent: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.sCn: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.sContent: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.sCn: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

sentences.sContent: ...and there is significant development potential in many other places...
...Since the significant progress made in Chinese education...
...Carli says that one of the most significant things about his study is that it provides new early-warning signs for parents...
...But perhaps it's more significant than our social scientists allow...
...In the eyes of the rest of the world and a significant part of its own population...
...And while Rubinoff believes there are a good number of four-year schools that truly care about these students and set aside significant resources and programs for them...
...and professors who all provided significant support for students who lacked confidence about "belonging" at such a top institution...
...it would add significant cost and complexity to an emerging industry that has until now operated largely as the playground of billionaires and dreamy engineers...
...one we ought to take steps to preserve as we would a historic building or a significant work of art...
...The ideal of country life reflected in art and literature serves as the significant feature of Chinese civilization...
...it may be decades before clean technologies like wind and solar meet a significant portion of our energy needs...
...a significant reduction of wasteful agricultural subsidies could also lower the deficit...
...But when it comes to a significant graduation gap...
...Leadership is the most significant word in today's competitive business environment because it directs the manager of a business to focus inward on their personal capabilities and style...
...Google could become a significant force in bookselling...
...have calculated that people kicking the habit have been responsible for a small but significant portion of the US epidemic of fatness...

synos.tran: 重大的；有效的；有意义的；值得注意的；意味深长的

phrases.pCn: 显著水准；检验水准；有效水平
有意味的形式；蕴意形式；言之有意的形式

words.tran: 有意义的；表示…的；为…提供推定证据的
意味深长地；值得注目地
有重要性；要紧；冒充内行

trans.tranOther: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future
